lessons.title: What is a Computer?
lessons.content:
# What is a Computer?

A computer is an electronic device that processes data and performs tasks according to instructions.

## Characteristics of Computers

- **Speed**: Computers can perform millions of calculations per second
- **Accuracy**: Computers rarely make mistakes if programmed correctly
- **Storage**: Can store large amounts of data
- **Automation**: Can work automatically once programmed

## Uses of Computers

- Education and learning
- Communication
- Entertainment
- Business and banking
- Scientific research

lessons.title: Parts of a Computer
lessons.content:
# Parts of a Computer

A computer system has several important parts that work together.

## Input Devices
- **Keyboard**: For typing text and numbers
- **Mouse**: For pointing and clicking
- **Microphone**: For recording sound

## Output Devices
- **Monitor**: Displays information
- **Printer**: Prints on paper
- **Speakers**: Produces sound

## Processing Unit
- **CPU (Central Processing Unit)**: The brain of the computer
- Processes all instructions and data

lessons.title: Computer Memory
lessons.content:
# Computer Memory

Computers use memory to store information.

## Types of Memory

### Primary Memory (RAM)
- Temporary storage
- Data is lost when computer is turned off
- Fast access

### Secondary Memory
- Permanent storage
- Hard disk, USB drive, CD/DVD
- Data remains even when computer is off

lessons.title: Computer Software
lessons.content:
# Computer Software

Software is a set of instructions that tells the computer what to do.

## Types of Software

### System Software
- Operating System (Windows, Linux, macOS)
- Controls the computer hardware

### Application Software
- Programs for specific tasks
- MS Word, Paint, Games, Web browsers

questions.question: What is a computer?
options: An electronic device that processes data
questions.explanation: A computer is an electronic device that processes data and performs tasks according to instructions.

questions.question: Which of these is an input device?
questions.explanation: A keyboard is an input device used to enter data into the computer.

questions.question: What does CPU stand for?
questions.explanation: CPU stands for Central Processing Unit, which is the brain of the computer.

questions.question: Which memory loses data when the computer is turned off?
questions.explanation: RAM (Random Access Memory) is temporary memory that loses data when power is turned off.

questions.question: Which is an output device?
questions.explanation: A monitor is an output device that displays information from the computer.

questions.question: What is system software?
questions.explanation: System software includes the Operating System which controls the computer hardware.

questions.question: Which characteristic allows computers to work without human intervention?
questions.explanation: Automation allows computers to work automatically once programmed.

questions.question: Which device is used for permanent storage?
questions.explanation: Hard disk is a secondary storage device that stores data permanently.

questions.question: What type of software is MS Word?
questions.explanation: MS Word is application software used for word processing tasks.

questions.question: Which device converts computer output to paper?
questions.explanation: A printer is an output device that prints computer output on paper.
